poem:
#### The Discipline of Desire

In the stark room of memory,  
desire smolders like a cold fire;  
the young, an echo of past vigor.  
Words wait, crouched in corners,  
biding their time,  
until the body spends itself.  
In the aftermath—a silence—  
not of shame, but of readiness,  
where the pen hesitates,  
then finds its way.
